meanings.sent1: The path through the woods was narrowish, making it tricky to walk side by side.
meanings.sent2: The hallway was narrowish, only allowing one person to pass through at a time.
meanings.sent3: The narrowish gap between the two trees seemed like a challenge for the squirrel to squeeze through.
meanings.sent4: Her narrowish focus on the details sometimes caused her to miss the bigger picture.
meanings.sent5: The narrowish stream snaked its way through the meadow, reflecting the sunlight beautifully.

meanings.definition: Tending to be narrow in size or scope.
meanings.sent1: His narrowish view of the world limited his understanding of different cultures.
meanings.sent2: The company's narrowish approach to marketing only targeted a specific group of customers.
meanings.sent3: The narrowish selection of toppings at the pizza place left him craving more variety.
meanings.sent4: Her narrowish opinions on politics made it challenging to have open discussions with her.
meanings.sent5: The narrowish range of colors in the painting gave it a unique and focused aesthetic.
